summary: Guide to building a research deep agent with planning, file system tools, and subagent capabilities.

structure.title: Quickstart
structure.summary: Guide to building a research deep agent with planning, file system tools, and subagent capabilities.

nodes.title: Prerequisites
nodes.summary: Prerequisites for setting up and running a deep agent, including installing dependencies and configuring API keys.

nodes.path: quickstart > Quickstart > Prerequisites > Step 1: Install dependencies
nodes.title: Step 1: Install dependencies
nodes.summary: Step-by-step guide to install necessary dependencies for deepagents and tavily-python using pip, uv, or poetry.

nodes.path: quickstart > Quickstart > Prerequisites > Step 2: Set up your API keys
nodes.title: Step 2: Set up your API keys
nodes.summary: Instructions for setting up API keys for services like Anthropic and Tavily.

nodes.path: quickstart > Quickstart > Prerequisites > Step 3: Create a search tool
nodes.title: Step 3: Create a search tool
nodes.summary: Step 3 guides users to create a search tool using the TavilyClient API for web searches.

nodes.path: quickstart > Quickstart > Prerequisites > Step 4: Create a deep agent
nodes.title: Step 4: Create a deep agent
nodes.summary: Create a deep agent with specific research instructions and an internet search tool for gathering information.

nodes.path: quickstart > Quickstart > Prerequisites > Step 5: Run the agent
nodes.title: Step 5: Run the agent
nodes.summary: Run the agent by invoking it with user messages and print the response.

nodes.title: What happened?
nodes.summary: The deep agent automatically planned, researched, managed context, spawned subagents if needed, and synthesized a report.

nodes.title: Next steps
nodes.summary: Provides guidance on customizing agents, understanding middleware, adding long-term memory, and deploying LangGraph applications.
